text.title: Peru in 2 Weeks: Epic Adventure from Amazon to Machu Picchu
text.p: from the heart of the Amazon rainforest
to the ancient Ana Trail to Machu piku
in this video we will take you on our
two week adventure through kuu May it
Inspire your own epic journey to this
beautiful
[Music]
country after an 8 and 1/2 hour
overnight flight from LAX our journey
began in Peru's vibrant Capital Lima we
arrived at 7:30 a.m. M so obviously our
first priority was coffee and breakfast
makx it real
good first coffee of the trip tastes the
best we barely got any sleep on the
flight so it's
necessary with only one day in Lima
until the very end of our trip we fought
our jet lag and explored the upscale
neighborhood of Mira Flores where we
were staying the John F Kennedy Park
also known as the cat Park is a must for
cats lovers there were cats
[Music]
everywhere we also walked to the iconic
Love Park and admired the ocean
views after a quick break at our hotel
it was time to head out for dinner and
we had very exciting plans for dinner
that
night we had made reservations months in
advance to dine at Mido the number six
best restaurant in the world known for
for their Peruvian Japanese Fusion the
tasting menu included 11 courses and
each dish was better than the last our
personal favorite was the Toro fatty
tuna Bell niri that was prepared right
in front of us good thank you it was
seriously the best food I have ever
[Music]
eaten okay thanks to me happy birthday
to
[Music]
we got up bright and early for a 1 and
half hour flight from Lima to Puerto
Maldonado one of Peru's gateways to the
Amazon with one of the smallest airports
we have been to so
far after a stop at the rainforest
expedition's office we had a 1our drive
to the tambopata
River from there it was a 2 and 1/2 hour
boat ride to the Eco Lodge deep in the
heart of the Amazon rainforest and only
accessible by
boat along the way we even caught our
first glimpse of a capibara and a
Cayman for the next 4 days we would be
staying at the tambopata research center
the only Lodge located within the
tambopata nation National
Reserve looking for crits it's
allinclusive and the top rated EOD in
the area and with its location deep in
the jungle it has the highest chances of
seeing Wildlife such as monkeys and
maybe even a Jaguar fingers
crossed P.S I'll leave the links to all
of our hotels from this trip in the
description in case you're interested
our first
crit now we had the evening to do our
first trick Through the Jungle with our
own private
[Music]
guide we saw lots of creepy crawlers
including our first tarantula oh my
god wow it's kind of cute though right
wow it yeah it eyes are
[Music]
shining now we had three full days in
the Amazon rainforest
each day our private guide would take us
on Expeditions Through the Jungle
looking for wildlife definitely has a
suction to it feel like such an
adventurer don't fall in do we saw tons
of adorable monkeys Creepy Crawlers
colorful birds and so much
more but sadly no Jaguars we'll just
have to come back again
someday it was so learning about these
amazing creatures and seeing them in
their natural
[Music]
habitat one of our favorite parts of our
stay in the Amazon was visiting the MAA
clay we got there just after Sunrise as
hundreds of MAA gathered it was truly a
once- in a-lifetime
experience
if you want to see more of our time in
the Amazon and all of the amazing
creatures that we saw there make sure to
watch our full video exploring Peru's
Amazon rainforest I'll link it down
below but make sure to watch it after
this video of
[Music]
course wow oh that's
creepy he's so cute
sadly our time in the Amazon had come to
an end today we would be making the long
journey by boat and bus out of the
Amazon jungle back to Puerto Maldonado
adios
[Applause]
[Music]
jungle bye
am from Puerto Maldonado it was a 1 and
1/2 hour flight to Lima and then a 1 and
1/2 hour flight to Cusco exhausted from
a long travel day we checked into our
hotel in Cusco and pretty much went
straight to
bed now we had two full days in Cusco
our main goal was to acclimate to the
high altitude before we began hiking the
Inca Trail but we were excited to
explore the city not going to lie I was
definitely dealing with some altitude
sickness during this time but we powered
through it and made the most of our time
in stupid guy first we had booked a full
day tour from Cusco to explore the
nearby sacred Valley fun fact the Alpaca
Farm that we visited was at a higher
altitude than Cusco and I actually
fainted in their gift shop the workers
there were so nice and gave me this AGA
de Florida which apparently helps with
altitude sickness at least I feel like
it helped me PSA altitude sickness can
happen to anyone so be prepared and make
sure to give yourself time to acclimate
before before doing the Inca
Trail the rest of the tour we visited
some ruins and learned about the history
of the Sacred
[Music]
Valley on our second day in Cusco we
explored the
[Music]
city
the city was beautiful the food was
amazing and I can't wait to spend more
time here
someday to watch our full 2 Days in
Cusco check out our 48 hours in Cusco
video linked
[Music]
below the highlight of our entire trip
to Peru hiking the Inca
Trail no Peru Adventure itinerary is
complete without this bucket list
Journey however this hike is tough we
have just done our first incline and my
heart was pumping luckily they've been
taking a ton of breaks thank God
spanning 4 days 26 M with a total
elevation gain of over 7,000 ft reaching
a Max altitude of nearly
14,000 ft I'm pretty nervous for today
cuz it's the dead wilman's pass and all
a pill all day but it is well worth the
challenge after facing some altitude
sickness in Cusco I was especially
nervous but I found that while very
challenging taking it slow with plenty
of breaks made this hike totally doable
made it to dead woman's pass woohoo if I
can do it you can do it while we're
watching me fight for my life on the
Inca Trail feel pity for Lenny
and hit that like button and consider
subscribing for more adventures and bad
[Music]
jokes somebody roll me down this hill
across the 4 days of hiking we saw the
most beautiful views that we had ever
seen hiking the Inca Trail was the most
challenging thing that we had ever done
but we all agreed we would do it again
in a heartbeat oh oh holy
yeah after four grueling days of hiking
we made it to Machu piku we made it to
Machu
piku if you haven't seen it yet make
sure to watch our hiking the Inca Trail
video next it's probably my favorite
video that we've made so
[Music]
far hiking the Inca Trail was so
rewarding and I high highly recommend it
if you
[Music]
[Music]
[Music]
can back in Cusco we had some chill time
to rest up before heading back to
Lima it was an easy 1 and 1/2 hour
flight back from Cusco to
Lima we walked around the laramar
Cliffside shopping mall and got dinner
before heading to bed
[Music]
early it was our last day in Peru and we
finally had some time to explore FL Lima
so to make the most of it we booked a
full day tour of the city through get
your guide honestly I was really glad
that we booked this tour in order to see
and do as much as we could in Lima in
our short stay the tour took us to a
local
market to the ocean where we did a
cooking class which was delicious by the
way and then to downtown Lima where we
visited the catacombs learned about the
history of the city and admired the
vibrant buildings I'll leave a link in
the description below to the Lima tour
that we did in case you're interested
our trip to Peru was action-packed and
full of Epic Adventures from visiting
the Amazon rainforest to hiking the Inca
Trail and Crossing that off our bucket
list if you're ready to dive into more
detail of our Peru adventures and
prepare yourself for your own trip don't
forget to check out the other videos in
our Peru travel series thanks for
watching we'll see you next time we out
here we sleeping on the
